Vulnerabilities: Injection vulnerability in the mermaid library

Steps.Description: The attacker identifies that the challenge is using the mermaid library.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that there may be a vulnerability in the mermaid library that can be exploited.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker looks for information or previous reports of vulnerabilities in the mermaid library.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker finds a link (https://github.com/knsv/mermaid/issues/548) discussing embedding an image into a mermaid flowchart.

Steps.Description: The attacker attempts injection to exploit the vulnerability.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that injecting malicious code through the image source attribute may lead to a successful attack.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker modifies the image source attribute to include JavaScript code that will trigger an alert when the image fails to load.
StepDetails.Result: The modified code successfully triggers an alert when the image fails to load.

Steps.Description: The attacker submits the modified code in the URL to obtain the flag.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker assumes that the modified code will be executed when the image source fails to load and hopes to extract the flag.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker submits the modified code in the URL.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully retrieves the flag.
